page.title: 05Taff's Well.
page.content: The village has a population of 8,000 and is essentially a linear trading area along Cardiff Road. The south west corner is dominated by waste ground and a small housing estate bounded by the River Taff. The local rugby ground is also situated here. The railway line runs parallel to the river and the major industries are situated to the east. New housing estates dominate the north east corner and the woodland of Fforest Fawr can be found to the south of these estates. The major industries in the area include a large metal manufacturing plant and several engineering works. There is also a small industrial estate situated between the railway line and the A470.
